intro: Synostemon stenocladus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland habitats and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Synostemon stenocladus is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to periodic flooding.
